TopicTitle: VAB/SPH: Remove Fuel & Ressources with one click

Articles.Content:
Is it possible to remove all fuel and ressources (mono, electricity, xenon, usw.) from a vessel or plane with one click or a simple shortcut?

If not: I think this will be a great feature to improve the design of the crafts. So you can easy see the CoM, CoL and CoT work together when the craft is empty. It's not that cool to remove all the fuel from a really big space plane to adjust CoM and CoL...

what do you think?

 

If it's possible: Let me know how. I never found something like this.

In stock, it doesn't exist, no. I personally have never really missed it, but I can see where it would come in handy for people with lots of planes (I'm more of a rocket person myself).

In FAR, there's a toggle for "full" (which actually refers to the current loadout) vs. "empty" when you do your stability analysis in the integrated tool. And RCS Build Aid is able to display a "dry CoM" marker along with the normal one in the editor.

Edited November 3, 2016 by Streetwind

If you have RCS build aid installed, you can select dry mass. That way you can see what you want  

If you look to that window, on the bottom, you see CoM and DCoM. The last one means the the Dry centre of mass.

I'm more the stock guy. I use just a small handfull of mods (graphical and mechjeb with kerbal engineerer). so i have to think about "rcs build aid".

i would love to have this feature in stock ksp as i think more people then just i would be happy about that.
rcs build aid build is quite the same sort of mod as mechjeb. It gives you info about your vessel, doesn´t add parts etc. It also gives you the amound of torgue etc. I see it as an eexpansion of KER
i understand. but i will add this mod just for this function. i dont use the aids expect the deltav calculation
